message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about environmentally-friendly practices. A person protecting the environment they have control over will most likely block in their yard. This means they will take measures to prevent pollutants and harmful substances from entering the environment. Option (B) is incorrect because salting the whole yard can harm plants and animals. Option (C) is incorrect because burning trash can release toxins into the air. Option (D) is incorrect because flooding the whole yard can cause water pollution and damage to the ecosystem.

To answer this question, we need to understand what actions contribute to protecting the environment. Option (A), blocking their yard, might refer to creating barriers or fences to prevent pollution or contaminants from entering the environment they have control over. This action helps to maintain the integrity of the environment and protect it from outside harm. 

Options (B), salting the whole yard, and (D), flooding the whole yard, are incorrect because they can have harmful effects on the environment. Salting the yard can damage plants and contaminate the soil, while flooding the yard can lead to erosion and disruption of the natural ecosystem.

Option (C), burning trash in the yard, is also incorrect as it can release harmful pollutants into the air and contribute to air pollution. This action does not protect the environment but rather harms it.

Therefore, the most likely action that a person protecting the environment they have control over would take is option (A), blocking their yard to prevent pollution and harm to the environment.
